title: Klondike Gold Rush - Seattle Unit National Historical Park: NPS Centennial
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     NPS Centennial             NPS Centennial       The National Park Service turns 100 on August 25, 2016. As we lead up to the centennial, we invite you to participate in Find Your Park Experiences to learn, discover, be inspired, or simply have fun in national parks. Find Your Park Experiences offer unique opportunities to explore national parks both in person and online. Check out the experiences in this park or search all experiences to identify an opportunity that matches your interests. You can also share your national park story at FindYourPark.com. A Call to Action remains the foundation for our 2016 centennial preparations. It is the National Park Service's blueprint for the future, outlining the innovative work we want to accomplish. Klondike Gold Rush - Seattle Unit National Historical Park is a big part of this effort. Take a look at what we're doing and get involved!   Experiences      All Aboard with Trails & Rails  All aboard for your next National Park adventure! Trails & Rails guides will help you Find Your Park from the comfort of your seat. Ride with our talented Trails & Rails volunteers on many Amtrak routes across the country. Read more      Call to Action Projects    Learn more about the work we're doing to prepare for the future.           Provided by ARRL   National Parks on the Air  In 2016, the National Park Service will celebrate its 100th anniversary, and radio amateurs will be able to help mark the occasion with the American Radio Relay League's National Parks on the Air (NPOTA) event. The fun begans on January 1, 2016.  More info
